Package javaArgs

Class JavaArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaArgs.JavaArgs
  • public class JavaArgs
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to facilitate the use of command line arguments in a Java program. Each argument has an associated key (to retrieve the argument) and tokens (used from command line). The steps to use this tool are the following: 1) Get an instance through the constructor. 2) Create the arguments and associate tokens to them. 3) Parse the command line arguments. 4) Retrieve the desired values.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ajordat

    • Method Detail

      • createArgument

        public BooleanArgument createArgument​(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.Boolean defaultsTo)
        Method to create a boolean argument. Each argument requires a key and a default value (nullable). This method returns the argument created in order to chain token additions. TODO: Create arguments with the same key. Alert with own exception.
        Parameters:
        key - Key associated to the argument.
        defaultsTo - Default value of the argument. If the value is a null Boolean, the argument is mandatory.
        Returns:
        The created argument.

      • createArgument

        public StringArgument createArgument​(java.lang.String key,
                                     java.lang.String defaultsTo)
        Method to create a string argument. Each argument requires a key and a default value (nullable). This method returns the argument created in order to chain token additions. TODO: Create arguments with the same key. Alert with own exception.
        Parameters:
        key - Key associated to the argument.
        defaultsTo - Default value of the argument. If the value is a null String, the argument is mandatory.
        Returns:
        The created argument.

      • createArgument

        public IntegerArgument createArgument​(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.Integer defaultsTo)
        Method to create an integer argument. Each argument requires a key and a default value (nullable). This method returns the argument created in order to chain token additions. TODO: Create arguments with the same key. Alert with own exception.
        Parameters:
        key - Key associated to the argument.
        defaultsTo - Default value of the argument. If the value is a null Integer, the argument is mandatory.
        Returns:
        The created argument.

      • getArguments

        public java.util.Collection<Argument> getArguments()
        Getter of all created arguments, ignoring type.
        Returns:
        All created arguments.

      • getArgument

        public Argument getArgument​(java.lang.String key)
        Method to retrieve an specific Argument from its key. TODO: Alert with own exception if the key doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the argument to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The argument requested.

      • getLoneArguments

        public java.lang.String[] getLoneArguments()
        Method to retrieve all parsed input arguments that weren't associated to an argument of JavaArgs.
        Returns:
        Array of strings with all unassociated input arguments.

      • parseInput

        public void parseInput​(java.lang.String[] input)
                throws ParsingException,
                       NumberParsingException
        Method to parse the input arguments of the program. After this call all configured parameters have been modified according to the user input. The developer can now retrieve all values from the arguments using their keys.
        Parameters:
        input - Array of Strings received from command line to the variable 'args' from the main method.
        Throws:
        ParsingException - Exception thrown if a compound argument can't get its value.
        NumberParsingException - Exception thrown if the value of a compound integer argument is not formatted as an Integer.

      • length

        public int length()
        Method to get the number of arguments read.
        Returns:
        The number of arguments read.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to know if it wasn't possible to read any arguments.
        Returns:
        If it wasn't possible to read any arguments.
